content:
User: C:\Users\jesse>pip show git-filter-repo Name: git-filter-repo Version: 2.47.0 Summary: Quickly rewrite git repository history Home-page: https://github.com/newren/git-filter-repo Author: Author-email: Elijah Newren <newren@gmail.com> License: MIT Location: C:\Users\jesse\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python313\site-packages Requires: Required-by:

Gemini: Location: C:\Users\jesse\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python313\site-packages
This explains why git filter-repo.exe is not in C:\Program Files\Python313\Scripts. pip installed it in your user-specific Python package location instead of the system-wide location.

Let's fix this by explicitly using the pip that is associated with your system-wide Python installation to reinstall git-filter-repo.

Please try this command, using the full path to your system-wide pip.exe:

"C:\Program Files\Python313\Scripts\pip.exe" uninstall git-filter-repo
and press Enter. This command will first uninstall the user-level installation of git-filter-repo. Answer y if it asks for confirmation to uninstall.

After it uninstalls, immediately run this command again using the full path to pip.exe:

"C:\Program Files\Python313\Scripts\pip.exe" install git-filter-repo
and press Enter. This will reinstall git-filter-repo, but this time, we are explicitly telling pip to use the pip.exe from your system-wide Python installation. Hopefully, this will install git-filter-repo in the correct location.

After running these two commands (uninstall and reinstall using the full path to pip.exe), please do the following:

Check for git-filter-repo.exe in Scripts Directory AGAIN:

Go back to C:\Program Files\Python313\Scripts using File Explorer and verify if git-filter-repo.exe is now present in this directory.

Test git filter-repo --version in Command Prompt:

Open a new command prompt and try running:

git filter-repo --version
Does it work this time? Does it show the version of git-filter-repo without errors?

Let me know the results of these steps. Did git-filter-repo.exe appear in Scripts? And does git filter-repo --version now work in a new command prompt?

By explicitly using the full path to the system pip.exe, we should be able to force the installation to the correct system-wide location. Let's see if this works!
